tool.name: AnteChamber

param.name: selected_output_format
param.label: Select an output file format (mol2 recommended!):

param.name: nc
param.label: Net charge. Default is 0
param.help: Specify the net charge for the molecule. (-nc)

param.name: c
param.label: Charge method
param.help: Charge method to use for the calculations. AM1-BCC or RESP recommended (-c)

param.name: at
param.label: Atom type
param.help: Create atom type for the specified forcefield (-at)

param.name: j
param.label: Atom type and bond type prediction index

param.name: usenc
param.label: use netcharge (recommended)
param.help: Can choose to let the charge be inferred by setting this to False.

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**What it does**
Antechamber sets up parameters for the input molecules provided.
.. class:: infomark
**How it works**
- Select an input file (PDB, mol2) - Specify the correct charge, or keep the default charge of 0 - Adjust other parameters as needed. - Click on Execute
.. class:: infomark
**Outputs created**
- A mol2 output is created with the forcefield compatible atom names.
.. class:: infomark
**User guide and documentation**
- AmberTools `userguide`_
.. _`userguide`: http://ambermd.org/doc12/Amber19.pdf
.. class:: infomark
**Feature requests**
Go to Galaxy Computational Chemistry and make a `feature request`_
.. _`feature request`: https://github.com/galaxycomputationalchemistry/galaxy-tools-compchem/issues/new
